translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Ideas
The Dyad of Unassociated with taints and with taints

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ sāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Āsavavippayuttaṁ anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam sa āsavam dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  āsava vippayuttam anāsavam dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ na anāsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unassociated with taints and with taints as condition, a non-taint and non-taint-accompanied state arises, a condition by way of root condition.🔽With an unassociated with taints and taintless as condition, a non-taint and non-taint-accompanied state arises, a condition by way of root condition. … three.

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ sāsavañca āsavavippayuttaṁ anāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto nanoanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam sa āsavañca āsava vippayuttam anāsavañca dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ na no anāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unassociated with taints and with taints and an unassociated with taints and taintless as condition, a non-taint and non-taint-accompanied state arises, a condition by way of root condition.

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With root cause as condition, five. With object as condition, two. … With none other than an object as condition, five. (In all cases, the detail is the same as above.)
The section on the taints is finished.
